tuv.seg: Disclosure in criminal cases
Nochtadh i gcásanna coiriúla
In a criminal trial the prosecution is obliged to disclose to the defence, in advance of the trial, all relevant evidence which it has
I dtriail choiriúil ní mór do lucht an ionchúisimh an fhianaise ábhartha go léir atá acu a nochtadh don lucht cosanta roimh an triail

If you are charged with a criminal offence, you have the right to be provided with the evidence the prosecution intends using at your trial, as well as the evidence which it has but does not intend to use, if that evidence could assist your defence

Má chúisítear tú as cion coiriúil, tá sé de cheart agat an fhianaise a bhfuil sé beartaithe ag lucht an ionchúisimh a úsáid ag do thriail a fháil, chomh maith leis an bhfianaise atá acu nach bhfuil sé beartaithe acu a úsáid, dá bhféadfadh an fhianaise sin cabhrú le do chosaint
This duty to disclose is based on natural and constitutional justice, case law and statutory principles
Tá an dualgas nochtaithe bunaithe ar cheartas nádúrtha agus bunreachtúil, cásdlí agus prionsabail reachtúla

However, the duty differs between summary prosecutions, which are tried in the District Court before a judge without a jury, and prosecutions on indictment, which are tried before a judge and jury in the Circuit Court or the Central Criminal Court

Ach baineann dualgas difriúil le ionchúisimh achoimre a thriailtear sa Chúirt Dúiche os comhair breithimh ach gan giúiré, agus ionchúisimh ar díotáil, a thriailtear os comhair breithimh agus giúiré sa Chúirt Chuarda nó sa Phríomh-Chúirt Choiriúil
In a summary case there is no general duty for the prosecution to provide you in advance with the statements of witnesses, whether or not you request them
I gcás achomair ní bhíonn dualgas ginearálta ar lucht an ionchúisimh ráitis finnéithe a sholáthar duit roimh ré, bíodh go bhfuil siad á lorg agat nó nach bhfuil
If you apply to the court to be provided with the statements, it is up to the court to decide whether it is in the interest of justice to provide you with them
Má déanann tú iarratas leis an gcúirt ar na ráitis a fháil, is faoin gcúirt socrú an ceart iad a sholáthar duit ar mhaithe le ceartas
The matters the court may need to consider were set out by the Supreme Court in Director of Public Prosecutions v Garry Doyle 2 IR 286
Leag an Chúirt Uachtarach na hábhair a d'fhéadfadh go mbeadh ar an gcúirt a mheas i i Director of Public Prosecutions v Garry Doyle 2 IR 286
When deciding whether or not to release evidence, the prosecution must consider similar principles
Agus iad ag smaoineamh ar cheart nó nár cheart fianaise a scaoileadh, ní mór do lucht an ionchúisimh prionsabail chosúlacha a mheas
If you are requesting that you be provided with the statements, the responsibility lies primarily with you or your solicitor to provide adequate reasons for the disclosure
Má iarrann tú go soláthrófaí ráitis duit, is é tú féin go príomha nó do aturnae atá freagrach as fáthanna dóthanacha leis an nochtadh a sholáthar

In a case of trial on indictment the prosecution has a statutory duty to provide you, in advance of your trial, with certain materials which sets out the evidence intended to be given in the trial against you

I gcás trialach ar díotáil tá dualgas reachtúil ar lucht an ionchúisimh ábhair áirithe a sholáthar duit roimh do thriail a leagann amach an fhianaise a bhfuil sé beartaithe a thabhairt sa triail i do choinne
These documents are usually referred to as the Book of Evidence
Is gnách go dtugtar an Leabhar Fianaise ar na doiciméid sin

When the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) consents to you being sent forward for trial, the DPP must serve the Book of Evidence on you (or your solicitor) within 42 days after you first appear in the District Court

Nuair a thoilíonn an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí (SIP) go gcuirfear ar aghaidh thú le triail, caithfidh an SIP an Leabhar Fianaise a sheirbheáil ort (nó ar d'aturnae) laistigh de 42 lá tar éis duit a bheith sa Chúirt Dúiche den chéad uair
The DPP can apply to the District Court to extend the 42 day period and normally the District Court will grant this extension if:
Is féidir leis an SIP iarratas a dhéanamh ar an gCúirt Dúiche chun síneadh a chur leis an tréimhse 42 lá, agus déanfaidh an Chúirt Dúiche an síneadh seo a dheonú go hiondúil sna cúinsí a leanas:
• There is a good reason for doing so
• Cúis mhaith lena leithéid a dhéanamh
• It would be in the interest of justice to do so
• Bheadh sé chun leasa an cheartais a leithéid a dhéanamh
The law does not set down any limit on the length of the extension
Ní leagann an dlí síos teorainn ar bith faoi fhad an tsínidh
There must, however, be a good reason for granting the extension, such as, if the Garda investigation is complex and there are a lot of witnesses involved in the case
Mar sin féin, caithfidh cúis mhaith a bheith le síneadh, cosúil le fiosrúchán na nGardaí a bheith casta agus mórán finnéithe a bheith bainteach leis an gcás
If the District Court refuses to grant an extension of time for service of the Book of Evidence, it must strike out the proceedings against you in relation to the offence
Má dhiúltaíonn an Chúirt Dúiche síneadh ama a thabhairt do sheirbheáil an Leabhair Fianaise, caithfear na himeachtaí i do choinne maidir leis an gcion a scriosadh amach
This does not mean that the case is over or finished
Ní chiallaíonn sé seo go bhfuil an cás dúnta nó tugtha chun críche
When the District Court strikes out the proceedings it is without prejudice to the institution of any proceedings against you by the DPP
Nuair a dhéanann an Chúirt Dúiche imeachtaí a scriosadh amach, tarlaíonn sé gan dochar do thionscnamh imeachtaí ar bith i do choinne ag an SIP
This means that the DPP can bring you before the court again on the same charges
Ciallaíonn sé seo gur féidir leis an SIP tú a thógáil os comhair na cúirte arís ar na cúisimh chéanna
If you intend relying on the evidence of any alibi at your trial you must give notice of the alibi to the prosecution within 14 days of being served the Book of Evidence
Má tá sé beartaithe agat a bheith ag brath ar fhianaise ailibí ar bith le linn trialach, caithfear an ailibí a fhógairt don ionchúiseamh laistigh de 14 lá ó sheirbheáil an Leabhair Fianaise
What does the Book of Evidence contain?
Cad atá cuimsithe sa Leabhar Fianaise?
The documents which must be served on you or your solicitor are as follows:
Is iad na doiciméid seo a leanas a chaithfear a sheirbheáil ort nó ar d'aturnae:
• A statement of the charges against you
• Ráiteas maidir leis na cúisimh i do choinne
• A copy of any sworn information (in writing) upon which the proceedings were started, that is, the written complaint made by a Garda
• Cóip d'fhaisnéis faoi mhionn (i scríbhinn) ónar eascair na himeachtaí, is é sin gearán scríofa a rinneadh chuig na Gardaí Síochána
• A list of the witnesses whom the DPP proposes to call at the trial
• Liosta na bhfinnéithe a bhfuil beartaithe ag an SIP glaoch orthu le linn na trialach
• A statement of the evidence that is expected to be given by each witness at the trial
• Ráiteas an fhianaise atáthar ag súil go dtabharfaidh gach finné ag an triail
• A list of any exhibits to be introduced at the trial
• Liosta na bhfoilseán atá le cur i láthair le linn na trialach
Once the Book of Evidence is prepared, it is served on you
Chomh luath agus atá an Leabhar Fianaise ullmhaithe, déantar é a sheirbheáil ort
The serving of the Book of Evidence does not mean that the DPP cannot serve additional documents on you at a later stage
Ní chiallaíonn seirbheáil an Leabhair Fianaise nach féidir leis an SIP doiciméid bhreise a sheirbheáil ort níos déanaí
At any time afterwards, the DPP must serve certain documents on you if they exist
Ag am ar bith ina dhiaidh sin, caithfidh an SIP doiciméid áirithe a sheirbheáil ort má tá a leithéidí ann
These additional documents include:
Áirítear na doiciméid bhreise seo a leanas ina measc:
• A list of any further witnesses the DPP proposes to call at the trial
• Liosta d'fhinnéithe breise ar bith a bhfuil beartaithe ag an SIP glaoch orthu le linn na trialach
• A statement of the evidence that is expected to be given by each witness whose name appears on the list of further witnesses
• Ráiteas faoin bhfianaise atáthar ag súil go dtabharfaidh gach finné atá ar an liosta d'fhinnéithe breise
• A statement of any further evidence that is expected to be given by any witness whose name appears on the earlier witness list
• Ráiteas faoin bhfianaise bhreise ar bith atáthar ag súil go dtabharfaidh finné ar bith atá ar an liosta finnéithe roimhe
• A list of any further exhibits
• Liosta na bhfoilseán breise ar bith
You have the right to inspect all exhibits mentioned in the list of exhibits
Tá sé de cheart agat gach foilseán a scrúdú, atá luaite ar liosta na bhfoilseán
Who compiles the Book of Evidence?
Cé a chuireann an Leabhar Fianaise le chéile?
While the Book of Evidence is compiled and served on behalf of the DPP, it is normally the investigating Garda who is responsible for putting the Book of Evidence together
Cé go bhfuil an Leabhar Fianaise curtha le chéile agus seirbheáilte ar son an SIP, is iondúil gurb é/í an Garda imscrúdaithe atá freagrach as an Leabhar Fianaise a chur le chéile
Work on the Book of Evidence starts immediately after your first appearance before the District Court
Tosaíonn obair ar an Leabhar Fianaise láithreach tar éis do chéad láithreas sa Chúirt Dúiche
As mentioned above, compiling a book of evidence can be a lengthy process especially if the case is complex and there are a large number of witnesses
Mar atá luaite thuas, is féidir le cur le chéile an leabhair fianaise a bheith ina phróiseas fadálach, go háirithe nuair atá an cás casta agus líon mór finnéithe i gceist
Witness statements normally are the largest class of document included in a Book of Evidence
Bíonn ráitis na bhfinnéithe go hiondúil ar an aicme doiciméad is mó sa Leabhar Fianaise
Statements from Gardaí, witnesses to the crime and expert witnesses (such as forensic experts and medical experts) are all gathered by the investigating Garda for inclusion in the Book of Evidence

Tá na ráitis ar fad ó Ghardaí, finnéithe na coire agus finnéithe saineolacha (cosúil le saineolaithe fóiréinseacha agus saineolaithe míochaine) bailithe le chéile ag an nGarda imscrúdaithe le háireamh sa Leabhar Fianaise
Is all the collected material disclosed?
An bhfuil an t-ábhar a bhailítear nochtadh go léir?
The prosecution may have other material which it has decided not to use at your trial
D'fhéadfadh go mbeadh ábhar breise ag lucht an ionchúisimh ar shocraigh siad gan a úsáid ag do thriail
Disclosure of this evidence should be made to you, without a request, if the evidence is relevant to your defence
Ba cheart an fhianaise sin a nochtadh duit, gan iarratas, má bhaineann an fhianaise le do chosaint
Further information on disclosure is available in the publication Guidelines for Prosecutors (pdf) which is available on the Director of Public Prosecutions’s website
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar nochtadh ar fáil san fhoilseachán Guidelines for Prosecutors (pdf) atá ar fáil ar Láithreán gréasáin an Stiúrthóra Ionchúiseamh Poiblí
